property.description: Property sheet to hold xml specification for forms for configurations
Download a specific cookbook from the Opscode repository.
Install a specific cookbook on a Chef client.
Upload one or more cookbooks from your local cookbook repository(ies) to the Chef Server. Only files that don't yet exist on the server will be uploaded.
Used by the dynamic environment feature to create a node.
Used by the dynamic environment feature to edit a node.
Used by the dynamic environment feature to delete a node.
Used to list all the nodes.
Used to show a node information.
Add recipes and roles to a node run-list. When using this procedure take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.
Remove recipes and roles from a node run-list. When using this procedure take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.
Run the chef-client command.
Used by the dynamic environment feature to install the chef client, register the node with the Chef server and converge. the node based on the run-list.
Used by the dynamic environment feature to delete the previously created chef node and chef client on the dynamic resource(s).
Edit data bag.
Edit data bag.
Edit data bag.
Displays all the present data bags.
Display the content of data bag.
Used to bootstrap a node.

formalParameter.description: Provide a unique name for the configuration, keeping in mind that you may need to create additional configurations over time.
URL of Chef server.
Provide a brief description of this configuration.
Private key for authentication.
Configuration Name

procedure.description: Download a specific cookbook from the Opscode repository.

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value).
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the cookbook to download. (Required)
Provide the specific version to download. If left blank the latest version will be downloaded.
If checked forces the download of a deprecated cookbook.
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Provide the file name to write to. The extension of this file name will be tar.gz. If not provided the default cookbook name will be used.
Provide the path where to download the cookbook, if no path is provided the cookbook will downloaded to the current workspace.

procedure.description: Install a specific cookbook on a Chef client

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the cookbook to install. (Required)
Provide the specific version to download. If left blank the latest version will be downloaded.
If checked cookbooks dependencies will not be installed automatically.
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Provide the path where to install the cookbook. is suggested to use the path where all cookbooks are stored e.g /etc/chef/cookbooks (This is the default value).
Provide the default branch to work with [ defaults to master ].

procedure.description: Upload one or more cookbooks from your local cookbook repository(ies) to the Chef Server. Only files that don't yet exist on the server will be uploaded.

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value).
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the cookbook(s) to upload, separate them by a space. (Required)
If checked all cookbooks will be uploaded.
Provide a colon-separated path to look for cookbooks in e.g /etc/chef/cookbooks/:/etc/chef/more_cookbooks.
If checked indicates that when a cookbook has a dependency on one or more other cookbooks, those cookbooks will also be uploaded.
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Provide any additional commands if needed.
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Name of node. (Required)
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Name of node. (Required)
Node information should be provided in Json Format. (Required)
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Name of node. (Required)
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
The property details in which result will be set.
Additional options
Show the corresponding URIs.
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Name of node. (Required)
The attribute (or attributes) to show.
The property details in which result will be set.
Additional options
Display all attributes in the output and show the output as JSON.
Display normal attributes in the output and to show the output as JSON.
Show only the run-list.

procedure.description: Add recipes and roles to a node run-list. When using this procedure take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the Node to add the recipes to. (Required)

Provide the run list items to add to the node run-list. Remember that you need to put the items in quotes when roles are been added, roles are been added combined with recipes, the recipe full qualified format is been used or the cookbook recipe format is been used. Take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Provide the item to use as a reference to place the new entries after in the node run-list e.g recipe[my_recipe].

procedure.description: Remove recipes and roles from a node run-list. When using this procedure take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the name of the Node to add the recipes to. (Required)

Provide the run list items to add to the node run-list. Remember that you need to put the items in quotes when roles are been added, roles are been added combined with recipes, the recipe full qualified format is been used or the cookbook recipe format is been used. Take into account that the Run List Items are not validated against the Chef server.
Additional options
Provide the path to the chef-client executable e.g /usr/bin/chef-client (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /etc/chef/client.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the node.
Provide a new run list items to place instead of the current run list.
Provide the JSON file or URL to load attributes from.
If checked the process will be daemonized.
Provide a interval in seconds for the chef-client to periodically run.
Choose the log level, available options are: Debug, Information, Warning, Error and Fatal.
Provide additional commands if needed.
Provide the path to the chef-client executable e.g /usr/bin/chef-client (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /etc/chef/client.rb (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
Provide the name of the node.
Provide a new run list items to place instead of the current run list.
Provide the JSON file or URL to load attributes from.
If checked the process will be daemonized.
Provide a interval in seconds for the chef-client to periodically run.
Choose the log level, available options are: Debug, Information, Warning, Error and Fatal.
Provide additional commands if needed.

procedure.description: Used by the dynamic environment feature to install the chef client, register the node with the Chef server and converge the node based on the run-list.

formalParameter.description: The name of an existing EC-Chef plugin configuration which holds all the information required to connect to a Chef server.
Path to the chef-client executable. E.g., /usr/bin/chef-client (This is the default value). (Required)
Enabled by default to allow chef-client to run as a user with elevated privileges (e.g., using sudo on *nix systems).
Comma-separated list of run-list items.
Unique name for the node that will be maintained by the chef-client. If left blank, Chef will use the Fully Qualified Domain Name of the node as the node name.
Any additional arguments that need to be passed to the chef-client

procedure.description: Used by the dynamic environment feature to delete the previously created chef node and chef client on the dynamic resource(s).

formalParameter.description: The name of resource or resource pool that was created earlier as a dynamic resource. The chef node and chef client for these resource(s) will be deleted.
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
The name of a specific data bag.
The name of a specific item within a data bag.
The encryption key that is used for values contained within a data bag item.
The path to the file that contains the encryption key.
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the name of data bag
Data Bag Item Content
The encryption key that is used for values contained within a data bag item.
The path to the file that contains the encryption key.
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
The name of a specific data bag.
The name of a specific item within a data bag.
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
The property details in which result will be set.
Show the corresponding URIs.
Additional options

procedure.description: Displays the content of data bag.

formalParameter.description: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the path and name of the configuration file e.g /root/.chef/knife.rb (This is the default value).
Provide the URL of the Chef Server to use.
The name of a specific data bag.
The name of a specific item within a data bag.
The encryption key that is used for values contained within a data bag item.
The path to the file that contains the encryption key.
The property details in which result will be set.
If checked a more verbose output is showed.
Additional options
Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife. (This is the default value). (Required)
Provide the ip of the node to bootstrap. (Required)
Additional options
Enables SSH agent forwarding.

Verify the SSL certificate on the Chef server. When true, the chef-client always verifies the SSL certificate. When false, the chef-client uses the value of ssl_verify_mode to determine if the SSL certificate requires verification. If this option is not specified, the setting for verify_api_cert in the configuration file is applied.
Use --no-host-key-verify to disable host key verification. Default setting: --host-key-verify.
Install pre-release gems.
Perform a bootstrap operation with sudo; specify the password with the -P (or --ssh-password) option.
Execute a bootstrap operation with sudo.
Specify arbitrary options to be added to the bootstrap command when using cURL
Execute a custom installation command sequence for the chef-client
Fetch and execute an installation script at the specified URL
The proxy server for the node that is the target of a bootstrap operation.
The proxy server for the node that is the target of a bootstrap operation.
The path to a JSON file that contains a list of vaults and items to be updated.
A single vault and item to update as vault:item.
A JSON string that contains a list of vaults and items to be updated.
The version of the chef-client to install.
Specify arbitrary options to be added to the bootstrap command when using GNU Wget. This option may not be used in the same command with --bootstrap-install-command.
The name of the environment. When this option is added to a command, the command will run only against the named environment.
The SSH tunnel or gateway that is used to run a bootstrap action on a machine that is not accessible from the workstation.
Ohai hints are used to tell Ohai something about the system that it is running on that it would not be able to discover itself.
The SSH identity file used for authentication. Key-based authentication is recommended.
A JSON string that is added to the first run of a chef-client.
The name of the node.
The SSH port.
The SSH password.
A comma-separated list of roles and/or recipes to be applied.
The encryption key that is used for values contained within a data bag item.
The path to the file that contains the encryption key.

The bootstrap template to use. This may be the name of a bootstrap templatechef-full, for exampleor it may be the full path to an Embedded Ruby (ERB) template that defines a custom bootstrap. Default value: chef-full, which installs the chef-client using the omnibus installer on all supported platforms.
Run the initial chef-client run at the debug log-level (e.g. chef-client -l debug).
The SSH user name.

Set the verify mode for HTTPS requests.Use none to do no validation of SSL certificates.Use peer to do validation of all SSL certificates, including the Chef server connections, S3 connections, and any HTTPS remote_file resource URLs used in the chef-client run. This is the recommended setting.
